column4: hi i can't get my graphics to work on my laptop can anyone help
what graphics card do you have?
geforce go5200
go to your terminal and type in sudo aptitude install nvidia-glx-new
ok i'll try that one sec.
after that, you should just need to hit ctrl+alt+backspace and it should work.... if it doesn't work after that, you'll need to edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf to read "nvidia" where it says "nv"
for some reason my terminal is sayin timestamp too far in the future
dunno what that means... is your clock configured to the right year?
hmm i don't know i can't change it, i just recently enocunteered this. never had this before
i'll restart and try again
can you still type in the terminal, regardless of the error message??
yes
just the sudo command doesn't work
although it did work before
doubtful a restart will work, but you can try
thanks alot it worked!
stil one more question, how do i configure the resolution manulaly
i'm using xubuntu, but in the display icon it doesn't allow me to add resolutions or change them
for that, you definitely need to sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf

you'll need to search for example xorg.conf files thru google... but you're looking for a section that says "modelines" & then lists a buncha resolutions... you'll wanna add all the resolutions your monitor can handle to that line
ok thnx
